intro: Tetrastigma rumicispermum var. rumicispermum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed grapevine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and tendrils that aid in climbing. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by black, berry-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
